meanings.definition: A person who grinds grain into flour.
meanings.sent1: The grister at the mill works hard to turn grain into flour.
meanings.sent2: I saw the grister at the farm grinding wheat into fine flour.
meanings.sent3: The grister decided to have a flour fight with the baker for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to become a skilled grister was as strong as the grinding stones.
meanings.sent5: The grister's hands were always covered in flour dust from the constant grinding.

meanings.definition: A machine used for grinding grain.
meanings.sent1: The old grister in the barn was still functional after many years.
meanings.sent2: Farmers rely on the grister to process their harvest into usable flour.
meanings.sent3: The grister and the thresher had a race to see who could finish first.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the grister echoed through the fields, signaling a successful harvest.
meanings.sent5: The grister's blades whirred as it turned grains into fine powder.

meanings.sent1: She would grister the wheat every morning to make fresh bread.
meanings.sent2: The old windmill would grister the grains with each gust of wind.
meanings.sent3: He tried to grister the corn using a coffee grinder, but it didn't work well.
meanings.sent4: The ancient stone wheel gristered the barley with a rhythmic motion.
meanings.sent5: The baker asked her to grister the oats finely for a special cake.
